thread.title: Venezuela buys 25% stake in Antigua and Barbuda oil company
thread.title_full: Venezuela buys 25% stake in Antigua and Barbuda oil company

title: Venezuela buys 25% stake in Antigua and Barbuda oil company
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Sun, Oct 18, 2015, 02:08 BST - UK Markets closed Venezuela buys 25% stake in Antigua and Barbuda oil company Venezuela to buy oil company stake, finance new resort in Antigua and Barbuda Associated Press – 18 minutes ago Print 
ST. JOHN'S, Antigua (AP) -- Venezuela says its state-owned oil company will buy a 25 percent stake in West Indies Oil Co. and establish a regional bank in Antigua with the local government to fund a new resort. 
The announcement came during a visit to Antigua by Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro. His stop Saturday is part of a weekend trip that includes three other Caribbean nations - Surinam, St. Lucia and Grenada. He is meeting with their leaders to discuss economic and social development initiatives. 
The Caribbean nations are members of the Petrocaribe program, through which Venezuela provides low-cost oil financing to Caribbean and Central American countries and invests in social development projects. Maduro defended the program Saturday and said it will become the foundation of a powerful economic zone.
